00068 /* gzip the file in from and write it to "to". 
00069  * return -1 if zlib fails, -2 if the originating file does not exist
00070  * note: will remove the "from" file
00071  */
00072 int BLI_file_gzip(const char *from, const char *to)
00073 {
00074     char buffer[10240];
00075     int file;
00076     int readsize = 0;
00077     int rval= 0, err;
00078     gzFile gzfile;
00079 
00080     /* level 1 is very close to 3 (the default) in terms of file size,
00081      * but about twice as fast, best use for speedy saving - campbell */
00082     gzfile = BLI_gzopen(to, "wb1");
00083     if (gzfile == NULL)
00084         return -1;
00085     file = BLI_open(from, O_BINARY|O_RDONLY,0);
00086     if (file < 0)
00087         return -2;
00088 
00089     while (1) {
00090         readsize = read(file, buffer, sizeof(buffer));
00091 
00092         if (readsize < 0) {
00093             rval= -2; /* error happened in reading */
00094             fprintf(stderr, "Error reading file %s: %s.\n", from, strerror(errno));
00095             break;
00096         }
00097         else if (readsize == 0)
00098             break; /* done reading */
00099         
00100         if (gzwrite(gzfile, buffer, readsize) <= 0) {
00101             rval= -1; /* error happened in writing */
00102             fprintf(stderr, "Error writing gz file %s: %s.\n", to, gzerror(gzfile, &err));
00103             break;
00104         }
00105     }
00106     
00107     gzclose(gzfile);
00108     close(file);
00109 
00110     return rval;
00111 }

00113 /* gzip the file in from_file and write it to memery to_mem, at most size bytes.
00114  * return the unziped size
00115  */
00116 char *BLI_file_ungzip_to_mem(const char *from_file, int *size_r)
00117 {
00118     gzFile gzfile;
00119     int readsize, size, alloc_size=0;
00120     char *mem= NULL;
00121     const int chunk_size= 512*1024;
00122 
00123     size= 0;
00124 
00125     gzfile = BLI_gzopen( from_file, "rb" );
00126     for (;;) {
00127         if (mem==NULL) {
00128             mem= MEM_callocN(chunk_size, "BLI_ungzip_to_mem");
00129             alloc_size= chunk_size;
00130         }
00131         else {
00132             mem= MEM_reallocN(mem, size+chunk_size);
00133             alloc_size+= chunk_size;
00134         }
00135 
00136         readsize= gzread(gzfile, mem+size, chunk_size);
00137         if (readsize>0) {
00138             size+= readsize;
00139         }
00140         else break;
00141     }
00142 
00143     if (size==0) {
00144         MEM_freeN(mem);
00145         mem= NULL;
00146     }
00147     else if (alloc_size!=size)
00148         mem= MEM_reallocN(mem, size);
00149 
00150     *size_r= size;
00151 
00152     return mem;
00153 }

00156 /* return 1 when file can be written */
00157 int BLI_file_is_writable(const char *filename)
00158 {
00159     int file;
00160     
00161     /* first try to open without creating */
00162     file = BLI_open(filename, O_BINARY | O_RDWR, 0666);
00163     
00164     if (file < 0) {
00165         /* now try to open and create. a test without actually
00166          * creating a file would be nice, but how? */
00167         file = BLI_open(filename, O_BINARY | O_RDWR | O_CREAT, 0666);
00168         
00169         if (file < 0) {
00170             return 0;
00171         }
00172         else {
00173             /* success, delete the file we create */
00174             close(file);
00175             BLI_delete(filename, 0, 0);
00176             return 1;
00177         }
00178     }
00179     else {
00180         close(file);
00181         return 1;
00182     }
00183 }
00184 
00185 int BLI_file_touch(const char *file)
00186 {
00187     FILE *f = BLI_fopen(file, "r+b");
00188     if (f != NULL) {
00189         char c = getc(f);
00190         rewind(f);
00191         putc(c, f);
00192     }
00193     else {
00194         f = BLI_fopen(file, "wb");
00195     }
00196     if (f) {
00197         fclose(f);
00198         return 1;
00199     }
00200     return 0;
00201 }

00212 void *BLI_gzopen(const char *filename, const char *mode)
00213 {
00214     gzFile gzfile;
00215 
00216     if (!filename || !mode) {
00217         return 0;
00218     }
00219     else {
00220         wchar_t short_name_16[256];
00221         char short_name[256];
00222         int i = 0;
00223 
00224         /* xxx Creates file before transcribing the path */
00225         if (mode[0] == 'w')
00226             fclose(ufopen(filename,"a"));
00227 
00228         UTF16_ENCODE(filename);
00229 
00230         GetShortPathNameW(filename_16,short_name_16, 256);
00231 
00232         for (i = 0; i < 256; i++) {
00233             short_name[i] = short_name_16[i];
00234         }
00235 
00236         gzfile = gzopen(short_name,mode);
00237 
00238         UTF16_UN_ENCODE(filename);
00239     }
00240 
00241     return gzfile;
00242 }

00249 int BLI_delete(const char *file, int dir, int recursive)
00250 {
00251     int err;
00252     
00253     UTF16_ENCODE(file);
00254 
00255     if (recursive) {
00256         callLocalErrorCallBack("Recursive delete is unsupported on Windows");
00257         err= 1;
00258     }
00259     else if (dir) {
00260         err= !RemoveDirectoryW(file_16);
00261         if (err) printf ("Unable to remove directory");
00262     }
00263     else {
00264         err= !DeleteFileW(file_16);
00265         if (err) callLocalErrorCallBack("Unable to delete file");
00266     }
00267 
00268     UTF16_UN_ENCODE(file);
00269 
00270     return err;
00271 }

00273 int BLI_move(const char *file, const char *to)
00274 {
00275     int err;
00276 
00277     // windows doesn't support moveing to a directory
00278     // it has to be 'mv filename filename' and not
00279     // 'mv filename destdir'
00280 
00281     BLI_strncpy(str, to, sizeof(str));
00282     // points 'to' to a directory ?
00283     if (BLI_last_slash(str) == (str + strlen(str) - 1)) {
00284         if (BLI_last_slash(file) != NULL) {
00285             strcat(str, BLI_last_slash(file) + 1);
00286         }
00287     }
00288     
00289     UTF16_ENCODE(file);
00290     UTF16_ENCODE(str);
00291     err= !MoveFileW(file_16, str_16);
00292     UTF16_UN_ENCODE(str);
00293     UTF16_UN_ENCODE(file);
00294 
00295     if (err) {
00296         callLocalErrorCallBack("Unable to move file");
00297         printf(" Move from '%s' to '%s' failed\n", file, str);
00298     }
00299 
00300     return err;
00301 }

00304 int BLI_copy(const char *file, const char *to)
00305 {
00306     int err;
00307 
00308     // windows doesn't support copying to a directory
00309     // it has to be 'cp filename filename' and not
00310     // 'cp filename destdir'
00311 
00312     BLI_strncpy(str, to, sizeof(str));
00313     // points 'to' to a directory ?
00314     if (BLI_last_slash(str) == (str + strlen(str) - 1)) {
00315         if (BLI_last_slash(file) != NULL) {
00316             strcat(str, BLI_last_slash(file) + 1);
00317         }
00318     }
00319 
00320     UTF16_ENCODE(file);
00321     UTF16_ENCODE(str);
00322     err = !CopyFileW(file_16, str_16, FALSE);
00323     UTF16_UN_ENCODE(str);
00324     UTF16_UN_ENCODE(file);
00325 
00326     if (err) {
00327         callLocalErrorCallBack("Unable to copy file!");
00328         printf(" Copy from '%s' to '%s' failed\n", file, str);
00329     }
00330 
00331     return err;
00332 }

00342 void BLI_dir_create_recursive(const char *dirname)
00343 {
00344     char *lslash;
00345     char tmp[MAXPATHLEN];
00346     
00347     /* First remove possible slash at the end of the dirname.
00348      * This routine otherwise tries to create
00349      * blah1/blah2/ (with slash) after creating
00350      * blah1/blah2 (without slash) */
00351 
00352     BLI_strncpy(tmp, dirname, sizeof(tmp));
00353     lslash= BLI_last_slash(tmp);
00354     
00355     if (lslash == tmp + strlen(tmp) - 1) {
00356         *lslash = 0;
00357     }
00358     
00359     if (BLI_exists(tmp)) return;
00360 
00361     lslash= BLI_last_slash(tmp);
00362     if (lslash) {
00363         /* Split about the last slash and recurse */
00364         *lslash = 0;
00365         BLI_dir_create_recursive(tmp);
00366     }
00367     
00368     if (dirname[0]) /* patch, this recursive loop tries to create a nameless directory */
00369         if (umkdir(dirname)==-1)
00370             printf("Unable to create directory %s\n",dirname);
00371 }
00372 
00373 int BLI_rename(const char *from, const char *to)
00374 {
00375     if (!BLI_exists(from)) return 0;
00376 
00377     /* make sure the filenames are different (case insensitive) before removing */
00378     if (BLI_exists(to) && BLI_strcasecmp(from, to))
00379         if (BLI_delete(to, 0, 0)) return 1;
00380     
00381     return urename(from, to);
00382 }

00384 #else /* The UNIX world */
00385 
00386 enum {
00387     /* operation succeeded succeeded */
00388     recursiveOp_Callback_OK = 0,
00389 
00390     /* operation requested not to perform recursive digging for current path */
00391     recursiveOp_Callback_StopRecurs = 1,
00392 
00393     /* error occured in callback and recursive walking should stop immediately */
00394     recursiveOp_Callback_Error = 2
00395 } recuresiveOp_Callback_Result;
00396 
00397 typedef int (*recursiveOp_Callback) (const char *from, const char *to);
00398 
00399 /* appending of filename to dir (ensures for buffer size before appending) */
00400 static void join_dirfile_alloc(char **dst, size_t *alloc_len, const char *dir, const char *file)
00401 {
00402     size_t len = strlen(dir) + strlen(file) + 1;
00403 
00404     if (!*dst)
00405         *dst = MEM_callocN(len + 1, "join_dirfile_alloc path");
00406     else if (*alloc_len < len)
00407         *dst = MEM_reallocN(*dst, len + 1);
00408 
00409     *alloc_len = len;
00410 
00411     BLI_join_dirfile(*dst, len + 1, dir, file);
00412 }
00413 
00414 static char *strip_last_slash(const char *dir)
00415 {
00416     char *result = BLI_strdup(dir);
00417     BLI_del_slash(result);
00418 
00419     return result;
00420 }
00421 
00422 static int recursive_operation(const char *startfrom, const char *startto, recursiveOp_Callback callback_dir_pre,
00423                                recursiveOp_Callback callback_file, recursiveOp_Callback callback_dir_post)
00424 {
00425     struct dirent **dirlist;
00426     struct stat st;
00427     char *from = NULL, *to = NULL;
00428     char *from_path = NULL, *to_path = NULL;
00429     size_t from_alloc_len = -1, to_alloc_len = -1;
00430     int i, n, ret = 0;
00431 
00432     /* ensure there's no trailing slash in file path */
00433     from = strip_last_slash(startfrom);
00434     if (startto)
00435         to = strip_last_slash(startto);
00436 
00437     ret = lstat(from, &st);
00438     if (ret < 0) {
00439         /* source wasn't found, nothing to operate with */
00440         return ret;
00441     }
00442 
00443     if (!S_ISDIR(st.st_mode)) {
00444         /* source isn't a directory, can't do recursive walking for it,
00445          * so just call file callback and leave */
00446         if (callback_file) {
00447             ret = callback_file(from, to);
00448 
00449             if (ret != recursiveOp_Callback_OK)
00450                 ret = -1;
00451         }
00452 
00453         MEM_freeN(from);
00454         if (to) MEM_freeN(to);
00455 
00456         return ret;
00457     }
00458 
00459 
00460     n = scandir(startfrom, &dirlist, 0, alphasort);
00461     if (n < 0) {
00462         /* error opening directory for listing */
00463         perror("scandir");
00464 
00465         MEM_freeN(from);
00466         if (to) MEM_freeN(to);
00467 
00468         return -1;
00469     }
00470 
00471     if (callback_dir_pre) {
00472         /* call pre-recursive walking directory callback */
00473         ret = callback_dir_pre(from, to);
00474 
00475         if (ret != recursiveOp_Callback_OK) {
00476             MEM_freeN(from);
00477             if (to) free(to);
00478 
00479             if (ret == recursiveOp_Callback_StopRecurs) {
00480                 /* callback requested not to perform recursive walking, not an error */
00481                 return 0;
00482             }
00483 
00484             return -1;
00485         }
00486     }
00487 
00488     for (i = 0; i < n; i++) {
00489         struct dirent *dirent = dirlist[i];
00490 
00491         if (!strcmp(dirent->d_name, ".") || !strcmp(dirent->d_name, "..")) {
00492             free(dirent);
00493             continue;
00494         }
00495 
00496         join_dirfile_alloc(&from_path, &from_alloc_len, from, dirent->d_name);
00497 
00498         if (to)
00499             join_dirfile_alloc(&to_path, &to_alloc_len, to, dirent->d_name);
00500 
00501         if (dirent->d_type == DT_DIR) {
00502             /* recursively dig into a folder */
00503             ret = recursive_operation(from_path, to_path, callback_dir_pre, callback_file, callback_dir_post);
00504         }
00505         else if (callback_file) {
00506             /* call file callback for current path */
00507             ret = callback_file(from_path, to_path);
00508             if (ret != recursiveOp_Callback_OK)
00509                 ret = -1;
00510         }
00511 
00512         if (ret != 0) {
00513             while (i < n)
00514                 free(dirlist[i]);
00515             break;
00516         }
00517     }
00518 
00519     free(dirlist);
00520 
00521     if (ret == 0) {
00522         if (callback_dir_post) {
00523             /* call post-recursive directory callback */
00524             ret = callback_dir_post(from, to);
00525             if (ret != recursiveOp_Callback_OK)
00526                 ret = -1;
00527         }
00528     }
00529 
00530     if (from_path) MEM_freeN(from_path);
00531     if (to_path) MEM_freeN(to_path);
00532 
00533     MEM_freeN(from);
00534     if (to) MEM_freeN(to);
00535 
00536     return ret;
00537 }
00538 
00539 static int delete_callback_post(const char *from, const char *UNUSED(to))
00540 {
00541     if (rmdir(from)) {
00542         perror("rmdir");
00543 
00544         return recursiveOp_Callback_Error;
00545     }
00546 
00547     return recursiveOp_Callback_OK;
00548 }
00549 
00550 static int delete_single_file(const char *from, const char *UNUSED(to))
00551 {
00552     if (unlink(from)) {
00553         perror("unlink");
00554 
00555         return recursiveOp_Callback_Error;
00556     }
00557 
00558     return recursiveOp_Callback_OK;
00559 }

00576 int BLI_delete(const char *file, int dir, int recursive) 
00577 {
00578     if (strchr(file, '"')) {
00579         printf("Error: not deleted file %s because of quote!\n", file);
00580     }
00581     else {
00582         if (recursive) {
00583             return recursive_operation(file, NULL, NULL, delete_single_file, delete_callback_post);
00584         }
00585         else if (dir) {
00586             return rmdir(file);
00587         }
00588         else {
00589             return remove(file); //BLI_snprintf(str, sizeof(str), "/bin/rm -f \"%s\"", file);
00590         }
00591     }
00592     return -1;
00593 }
00594 
00595 static int check_the_same(const char *path_a, const char *path_b)
00596 {
00597     struct stat st_a, st_b;
00598 
00599     if (lstat(path_a, &st_a))
00600         return 0;
00601 
00602     if (lstat(path_b, &st_b))
00603         return 0;
00604 
00605     return st_a.st_dev == st_b.st_dev && st_a.st_ino == st_b.st_ino;
00606 }
00607 
00608 static int set_permissions(const char *file, struct stat *st)
00609 {
00610     if (chown(file, st->st_uid, st->st_gid)) {
00611         perror("chown");
00612         return -1;
00613     }
00614 
00615     if (chmod(file, st->st_mode)) {
00616         perror("chmod");
00617         return -1;
00618     }
00619 
00620     return 0;
00621 }
00622 
00623 /* pre-recursive callback for copying operation
00624  * creates a destination directory where all source content fill be copied to */
00625 static int copy_callback_pre(const char *from, const char *to)
00626 {
00627     struct stat st;
00628 
00629     if (check_the_same(from, to)) {
00630         fprintf(stderr, "%s: '%s' is the same as '%s'\n", __func__, from, to);
00631         return recursiveOp_Callback_Error;
00632     }
00633 
00634     if (lstat(from, &st)) {
00635         perror("stat");
00636         return recursiveOp_Callback_Error;
00637     }
00638 
00639     /* create a directory */
00640     if (mkdir(to, st.st_mode)) {
00641         perror("mkdir");
00642         return recursiveOp_Callback_Error;
00643     }
00644 
00645     /* set proper owner and group on new directory */
00646     if (chown(to, st.st_uid, st.st_gid)) {
00647         perror("chown");
00648         return recursiveOp_Callback_Error;
00649     }
00650 
00651     return recursiveOp_Callback_OK;
00652 }
00653 
00654 static int copy_single_file(const char *from, const char *to)
00655 {
00656     FILE *from_stream, *to_stream;
00657     struct stat st;
00658     char buf[4096];
00659     size_t len;
00660 
00661     if (check_the_same(from, to)) {
00662         fprintf(stderr, "%s: '%s' is the same as '%s'\n", __func__, from, to);
00663         return recursiveOp_Callback_Error;
00664     }
00665 
00666     if (lstat(from, &st)) {
00667         perror("lstat");
00668         return recursiveOp_Callback_Error;
00669     }
00670 
00671     if (S_ISLNK(st.st_mode)) {
00672         /* symbolic links should be copied in special way */
00673         char *link_buffer;
00674         int need_free;
00675         ssize_t link_len;
00676 
00677         /* get large enough buffer to read link content */
00678         if (st.st_size < sizeof(buf)) {
00679             link_buffer = buf;
00680             need_free = 0;
00681         }
00682         else {
00683             link_buffer = MEM_callocN(st.st_size+2, "copy_single_file link_buffer");
00684             need_free = 1;
00685         }
00686 
00687         link_len = readlink(from, link_buffer, st.st_size+1);
00688         if (link_len < 0) {
00689             perror("readlink");
00690 
00691             if (need_free) MEM_freeN(link_buffer);
00692 
00693             return recursiveOp_Callback_Error;
00694         }
00695 
00696         link_buffer[link_len] = 0;
00697 
00698         if (symlink(link_buffer, to)) {
00699             perror("symlink");
00700             if (need_free) MEM_freeN(link_buffer);
00701             return recursiveOp_Callback_Error;
00702         }
00703 
00704         if (need_free)
00705             MEM_freeN(link_buffer);
00706 
00707         return recursiveOp_Callback_OK;
00708     }
00709     else if (S_ISCHR (st.st_mode) ||
00710             S_ISBLK (st.st_mode) ||
00711             S_ISFIFO (st.st_mode) ||
00712             S_ISSOCK (st.st_mode))
00713     {
00714         /* copy special type of file */
00715         if (mknod(to, st.st_mode, st.st_rdev)) {
00716             perror("mknod");
00717             return recursiveOp_Callback_Error;
00718         }
00719 
00720         if (set_permissions(to, &st))
00721             return recursiveOp_Callback_Error;
00722 
00723         return recursiveOp_Callback_OK;
00724     }
00725     else if (!S_ISREG(st.st_mode)) {
00726         fprintf(stderr, "Copying of this kind of files isn't supported yet\n");
00727         return recursiveOp_Callback_Error;
00728     }
00729 
00730     from_stream = fopen(from, "rb");
00731     if (!from_stream) {
00732         perror("fopen");
00733         return recursiveOp_Callback_Error;
00734     }
00735 
00736     to_stream = fopen(to, "wb");
00737     if (!to_stream) {
00738         perror("fopen");
00739         fclose(from_stream);
00740         return recursiveOp_Callback_Error;
00741     }
00742 
00743     while ((len = fread(buf, 1, sizeof(buf), from_stream)) > 0) {
00744         fwrite(buf, 1, len, to_stream);
00745     }
00746 
00747     fclose(to_stream);
00748     fclose(from_stream);
00749 
00750     if (set_permissions(to, &st))
00751         return recursiveOp_Callback_Error;
00752 
00753     return recursiveOp_Callback_OK;
00754 }
00755 
00756 static int move_callback_pre(const char *from, const char *to)
00757 {
00758     int ret = rename(from, to);
00759 
00760     if (ret)
00761         return copy_callback_pre(from, to);
00762 
00763     return recursiveOp_Callback_StopRecurs;
00764 }
00765 
00766 static int move_single_file(const char *from, const char *to)
00767 {
00768     int ret = rename(from, to);
00769 
00770     if (ret)
00771         return copy_single_file(from, to);
00772 
00773     return recursiveOp_Callback_OK;
00774 }
00775 
00776 int BLI_move(const char *file, const char *to)
00777 {
00778     int ret = recursive_operation(file, to, move_callback_pre, move_single_file, NULL);
00779 
00780     if (ret) {
00781         return recursive_operation(file, NULL, NULL, delete_single_file, delete_callback_post);
00782     }
00783 
00784     return ret;
00785 }
00786 
00787 static char *check_destination(const char *file, const char *to)
00788 {
00789     struct stat st;
00790 
00791     if (!stat(to, &st)) {
00792         if (S_ISDIR(st.st_mode)) {
00793             char *str, *filename, *path;
00794             size_t len = 0;
00795 
00796             str = strip_last_slash(file);
00797             filename = BLI_last_slash(str);
00798 
00799             if (!filename) {
00800                 MEM_freeN(str);
00801                 return (char*)to;
00802             }
00803 
00804             /* skip slash */
00805             filename += 1;
00806 
00807             len = strlen(to) + strlen(filename) + 1;
00808             path = MEM_callocN(len + 1, "check_destination path");
00809             BLI_join_dirfile(path, len + 1, to, filename);
00810 
00811             MEM_freeN(str);
00812 
00813             return path;
00814         }
00815     }
00816 
00817     return (char*)to;
00818 }
00819 
00820 int BLI_copy(const char *file, const char *to)
00821 {
00822     char *actual_to = check_destination(file, to);
00823     int ret;
00824 
00825     ret = recursive_operation(file, actual_to, copy_callback_pre, copy_single_file, NULL);
00826 
00827     if (actual_to!=to)
00828         MEM_freeN(actual_to);
00829 
00830     return ret;
00831 }
00832 
00833 int BLI_create_symlink(const char *file, const char *to)
00834 {
00835     return symlink(to, file);
00836 }
00837 
00838 void BLI_dir_create_recursive(const char *dirname)
00839 {
00840     char *lslash;
00841     size_t size;
00842 #ifdef MAXPATHLEN
00843     char static_buf[MAXPATHLEN];
00844 #endif
00845     char *tmp;
00846     int needs_free;
00847 
00848     if (BLI_exists(dirname)) return;
00849 
00850 #ifdef MAXPATHLEN
00851     size = MAXPATHLEN;
00852     tmp = static_buf;
00853     needs_free = 0;
00854 #else
00855     size = strlen(dirname)+1;
00856     tmp = MEM_callocN(size, "BLI_dir_create_recursive tmp");
00857     needs_free = 1;
00858 #endif
00859 
00860     BLI_strncpy(tmp, dirname, size);
00861         
00862     lslash= BLI_last_slash(tmp);
00863     if (lslash) {
00864             /* Split about the last slash and recurse */    
00865         *lslash = 0;
00866         BLI_dir_create_recursive(tmp);
00867     }
00868 
00869     if (needs_free)
00870         MEM_freeN(tmp);
00871 
00872     mkdir(dirname, 0777);
00873 }
00874 
00875 int BLI_rename(const char *from, const char *to)
00876 {
00877     if (!BLI_exists(from)) return 0;
00878     
00879     if (BLI_exists(to))
00880         if (BLI_delete(to, 0, 0)) return 1;
00881 
00882     return rename(from, to);
00883 }
00884 
00885 #endif
